# Asynchronous Programming Patterns Docs

## Asynchronous programming model (APM)

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/asynchronous-programming-model-apm.md): Learn about the Asynchronous Programming Model (APM) in .NET. Discover how to begin and end an asynchronous operation.

## Asynchronous programming patterns

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/index.md): Learn about the Task-based Asynchronous Pattern (TAP), Event-based Asynchronous Pattern (EAP), & Asynchronous Programming Model (APM) in .NET.

## Asynchronous programming using delegates

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/asynchronous-programming-using-delegates.md): Learn more about: Asynchronous Programming Using Delegates
- [Call synchronous methods asynchronously](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/calling-synchronous-methods-asynchronously.md): Learn how to call synchronous methods asynchronously in .NET, using the BeginInvoke and EndInvoke methods.

## Call asynchronous methods using IAsyncResult

- [Call asynchronous methods using IAsyncResult](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/calling-asynchronous-methods-using-iasyncresult.md): Learn more about: Calling Asynchronous Methods Using IAsyncResult
- [Block execution using an AsyncWaitHandle](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/blocking-application-execution-using-an-asyncwaithandle.md): Learn more about: Blocking Application Execution Using an AsyncWaitHandle
- [Block execution by ending an async operation](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/blocking-application-execution-by-ending-an-async-operation.md): Learn more about: Blocking Application Execution by Ending an Async Operation
- [Poll for the status of an async operation](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/polling-for-the-status-of-an-asynchronous-operation.md): Learn more about: Polling for the Status of an Asynchronous Operation

## Event-based asynchronous pattern (EAP)

- [Documentation overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/event-based-asynchronous-pattern-eap.md): See links to articles about the Event-based Asynchronous Pattern (EAP) in .NET, such as implementation, best practices, implementing an EAP client, and more.
- [EAP overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/event-based-asynchronous-pattern-overview.md): Review Event-based Asynchronous Patterns (EAPs) in .NET, which make available the advantages of multithreaded applications but hide some design complexities.
- [Implement the EAP](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/implementing-the-event-based-asynchronous-pattern.md): Learn how to implement the Event-based Asynchronous Pattern (EAP) in .NET. EAP is a standard way to package a class that has asynchronous features.
- [Best practices](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/best-practices-for-implementing-the-event-based-asynchronous-pattern.md): Learn more about: Best Practices for Implementing the Event-based Asynchronous Pattern
- [When to implement the EAP](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/deciding-when-to-implement-the-event-based-asynchronous-pattern.md): Learn more about: Deciding When to Implement the Event-based Asynchronous Pattern
- [Implement a component that supports the EAP](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/component-that-supports-the-event-based-asynchronous-pattern.md): Learn more about: How to: Implement a Component That Supports the Event-based Asynchronous Pattern
- [Implement a client of the EAP](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/how-to-implement-a-client-of-the-event-based-asynchronous-pattern.md): Learn more about: How to: Implement a Client of the Event-based Asynchronous Pattern
- [Use components that support the EAP](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/how-to-use-components-that-support-the-event-based-asynchronous-pattern.md): Learn more about: How to: Use Components That Support the Event-based Asynchronous Pattern

## Task-based asynchronous pattern (TAP)

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/task-based-asynchronous-pattern-tap.md): Learn about the Task-based Asynchronous Pattern (TAP), and compare it to the legacy patterns: Asynchronous Programming Model (APM) and Event-based Asynchronous Pattern (EAP).
- [Implement the TAP](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/implementing-the-task-based-asynchronous-pattern.md): This article explains how to implement the Task-based Asynchronous Pattern. You can use it to implement compute-bound and I/O-bound asynchronous operations.
- [Consume the TAP](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/consuming-the-task-based-asynchronous-pattern.md): Learn to consume the Task-based Asynchronous Pattern (TAP) when working with asynchronous operations.
- [Interop with other asynchronous patterns and types](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/interop-with-other-asynchronous-patterns-and-types.md): Learn more about: Interop with Other Asynchronous Patterns and Types

## Use an AsyncCallback delegate to end an async operation

- [Use an AsyncCallback delegate to end an async operation](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/using-an-asynccallback-delegate-to-end-an-asynchronous-operation.md): Learn more about: Using an AsyncCallback Delegate to End an Asynchronous Operation
- [Use an AsyncCallback delegate and state object](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/using-an-asynccallback-delegate-and-state-object.md): Learn more about: Using an AsyncCallback Delegate and State Object
